description: Partly representing a colloquial pronunciation of my +‎ lady, partly from French milady, from English my Lady. Compare milord.

entries.meaning: (now chiefly historical or humorous) An English noblewoman or gentlewoman; the form of address to such a person; a lady. [from 18th c.]

verbs.description: milady (third-person singular simple present miladies, present participle miladying, simple past and past participle miladied or miladyed)
